title: 106_s1326
content: The "Citizen Congress Act" limits retirement coverage for members of Congress. The "Citizen Congress Act" restricts members of Congress from participating in the Civil Service Retirement System or the Federal Employees' Retirement System, except for the Thrift Savings Plan within a 12-year period. Refunds of contributions are allowed under certain circumstances. The "Citizen Congress Act" prohibits members of Congress from joining the Civil Service Retirement System or the Federal Employees' Retirement System, except for the Thrift Savings Plan within a 12-year period. Refunds of contributions are permitted if a member becomes ineligible to participate in the retirement systems. Annuities based on prior service before the Act's enactment are not affected by these changes. The "Citizen Congress Act" prohibits members of Congress from joining certain retirement systems. All service and pay as a Member of Congress is disregarded, except for service performed before the Act's enactment. Rights based on prior service are preserved to the extent practicable. The "Citizen Congress Act" preserves the rights of members of Congress regarding annuities or benefits after separation, ensuring entitlement based on the date of enactment. Regulations for implementation may be set by the Office of Personnel Management and the Executive Director. The "Citizen Congress Act" ensures that members of Congress are entitled to annuities or benefits based on the date of enactment. The definition of "Member of Congress" is clarified, and the section does not apply to savings plans outside of specific chapters in the United States Code. SEC. 3. DISCLOSURE OF ESTIMATES OF FEDERAL RETIREMENT BENEFITS OF MEMBERS OF CONGRESS. The Secretary of the Senate and the Clerk of the House of Representatives must report individual contributions made by Members of Congress to retirement funds and provide estimates of their future annuities. The section specifies the information required for calculating federal retirement benefits for Members of Congress based on retirement date and years of service. It will take effect one year after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 4. ELIMINATION OF AUTOMATIC ANNUITY ADJUSTMENTS FOR MEMBERS OF CONGRESS. The annuity portion based on congressional service will not receive cost-of-living adjustments. SEC. 5. ELIMINATION OF AUTOMATIC PAY ADJUSTMENTS FOR MEMBERS OF CONGRESS. Repeals pay adjustments for Members of Congress. SEC. 6. ROLLCALL VOTE FOR ANY CONGRESSIONAL PAY RAISE. SEC. 6. Requires a rollcall vote in Congress for any matter related to Members of Congress' pay.
